meanings.definition: The act of being overly frugal or stingy.
meanings.sent1: Her cheeseparing with money meant she never treated herself to anything nice.
meanings.sent2: His cheeseparing with compliments made others feel unappreciated.
meanings.sent3: Tom's cheeseparing with sharing snacks always left him with a full bag of chips.
meanings.sent4: The company's cheeseparing with resources led to a decline in product quality.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's cheeseparing with heating kept the house chilly even in winter.

meanings.sent1: She only had a cheeseparing of time to finish the project.
meanings.sent2: The beggar asked for a cheeseparing of food to ease his hunger.
meanings.sent3: The cheeseparing of paint left on the brush was not enough to cover the wall.
meanings.sent4: His contribution was just a cheeseparing compared to the overall effort.
meanings.sent5: The cheeseparing of sugar in the recipe made the dessert less sweet.

meanings.sent1: She placed a cheeseparing on top of the cracker.
meanings.sent2: The chef added a cheeseparing of cheddar to the salad.
meanings.sent3: The mouse nibbled on the cheeseparing left on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: He savored the cheeseparing of brie with a glass of wine.
meanings.sent5: The cheeseparing of gouda melted perfectly on the warm bread.
